item.title: All The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered PC System Requirements—Minimum, Recommended & Best Specs
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/ail-the-last-of-us-part-2-remastered-pc-system-requirements/

The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered makes its bow on PC, broadening the game’s availability. The survival title already looked unbelievable on consoles, so let’s tell you its PC specs and system requirements to have you clacking at Clickers in no time.

The Last of Us Part 1 Remastered came to PC, so it makes sense for The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered to follow suit. Naughty Dog’s award-winning sequel is here in all its remastered and revitalized glory. It features the complete dual-narrative of The Last of Us Part 2 but comes with lots of new features.

Not everyone’s PC setup is the same. This is why system requirements are important before a game’s release. Naughty Dog has unveiled the entire list of PC specs and requirements here, and you should look to see which tier you are compatible with.

The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered Minimum Requirements on PC

The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered’s requirements are split into four categories: Minimum, Recommended, High, and Very High settings. Minimum is what you need to run Part 2 at all. We need to hit these requirements to ensure the game works and we don’t run into any problems.

The game runs better the closer you get to “Very High.” This is reserved for the most elite gaming configurations though, so don’t be disheartened if you fall short of the requirements.

item.title: Ubisoft Stock Falls Double Digits Days After Tencent Deal
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/ubisoft-stock-falls-double-digits-days-after-tencent-deal/

Ubisoft’s stock is falling again. Just days after the French-based publisher announced a deal for a new subsidiary in partnership with Tencent, the company’s stock fell by double digits on Monday.

Looking at the markets in the United States (US), United Kingdom (UK), and France, the company’s stock fell by at least 11.80%. As of closing in the UK, Ubisoft was trading for €11.19 compared to the €12.15 it opened at. In France, stock prices fell 12.06% down to €11.16.

The fall fully erases the 11% gain the company saw in stock prices on Friday, less than a day after it was announced.

READ MORE: EXCLUSIVE – Yves Guillemot’s Internal Memo on Ubisoft and Tencent’s New Subsidiary

Shortly after the deal was announced, multiple employees reached out to express worry over layoffs at Ubisoft for those not working on the included franchises.

Ubisoft says that it expects the deal with Tencent for the new subsidiary to be completed before the end of 2025. When it closes, Ubisoft will maintain 75% control of the new company that includes Assassin’s Creed, Rainbow Six, and Far Cry games.

item.title: ASUS Seemingly Teases Project Kennan Xbox Handheld Ahead Of Reveal
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/asus-seemingly-teases-project-kennan-xbox-handheld-ahead-of-reveal/

ASUS is teasing something big for its Republic of Gamers (ROG) lineup on social media. In a short video teaser posted on Monday afternoon, ASUS teased what’s next for the ROG Ally. And what’s next is expected to be the rumored ASUS Xbox handheld currently known as Project Kennan.

According to recent rumors and reports, this device isn’t going to be the standalone Xbox handheld that Microsoft is actively working on. Instead, it’s going to be a third-party device that will include Xbox branding.

Specifics on what the device will be remain scarce, including exact details on how it will fit as an Xbox device. A recent report from Windows Central seemed to make it clear that the system won’t play Xbox games as it will be a “tried-and-true Windows PC in essence”. Instead, it will be act like the current ROG Ally while featuring an Xbox Guide button and “more prominent grips”.

Lastly, it’s also unknown if it will feature any other spec updates over the original ROG Ally or will be similar to the anticipated ROG Ally 2.

What do you think the ASUS-Xbox Handheld known as Project Kennan will include? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.
